intro: Dissotis quinquenervis, commonly known as the five-veined dissotis, is a flowering plant native to tropical regions of Africa and Asia. It belongs to the family Rubiaceae, which includes over 13,000 species of flowering plants. The plant is characterized by its slender, creeping stems and small, lance-shaped leaves with five distinct veins. Its flowers are typically white or pale yellow, with five petals and a prominent calyx. It is often found in moist, shaded environments such as forest floors or along stream banks.
